p: Even in Ethiopia, with a tragic history of food insecurity and famine, industrial meat operations are expanding, as people in middle- and upper-income brackets seek to eat more “Western” diets and industrialists look to export markets in the Middle East and the European Union. Intense new competition is likely to ensue in the country for grains and oilseeds, as well as access to water and land, between fast-rising populations of people and livestock.7
